inn1.comm: short of length on middle with a bit of inswing, QDK defends it back
gets room this time outside off and it's short too, punches off the back foot between cover and cover point for two
back of length on leg, tucked to midwicket

big appeal and de Kock is caught down the leg side! It was short again and going down leg, de Kock tried to tuck it off his hips fine on leg but looks like he got a glove just while trying to pull out of the shot. The appeal was replied instantly by Aleem Dar
short of length outside off, Faf lets it go
back of length outside off, Faf pushes straight to cover
starts with a wide way down leg and swinging it away from the batsman
outside off on length this time, Amla pokes without much footwork and misses
even wider outside off from length, Amla lets it go
strays down leg again for another wide
much better now, length delivery towards the off stump and Amla defends it on the leg side
swings it in towards leg stump from short of length, tucked off the hips to deep fine leg for two and he's off the mark
fuller around off stump, pushed down to mid-off
shapes it in a bit from outside off, Amla leaves it alone
a hint of seam away, but it's nothing to bother the batsman who gets back and taps it in front of point
nicely done, not looking to hit it too hard as he pushes a fuller ball from off stump down the ground. Mid-on gets the skates on to his left and stops it
back of a length with that nibble away again, Amla hoists his bat high over his head
jumps on the back foot and blocks a shortish ball on middle. Loud thud as he connected
did that stop on him? Amla was into the drive a touch too early as he met a good length ball homing in on the stumps. It lobs between the non-striker and the stumps to mid-on
good length ball outside off, punched to mid-off
shuffles across outside off as Nyumbu flights lures him. But there's very little turn so he stays back and punches int othe covers
looped up outside off, Faf stretches forward to defend
stays back with this not having as much air and hits with the turn, only a little though, to mid-on
leans on the front foot as he got the pitch of the ball but can't get it far enough past the bowler's right
now he does, with a little more flight on the ball. Eased down to long-on
that's the quicker one, doesn't really work on Amla and his swift hands which flicks through to deep midwcket
full and just wide enough for Amla to flay at it, limited footwork which might have hurt his timing. Toe-ended it to mid-off
back of a good length on off stump, Faf protects it with a punch to cover
angled in at Faf and snares the inside edge as Faf looks to push down the ground. Hands on heads time for Chatara as it goes to square leg
that's lobbed over short midiwcket! It was full and steered on the pads, Faf whips it in the air and just enough over the leaping fielder to get three runs
good length ball around the off stump, keeps Amla to a defensive push
works an acute angle into the batsman as he goes wide of the crease, Amla plonks the straight bat in its way
touch more bounce that time as Faf has to adjust. Stays on the back foot and is also midly started by the seam back in. Bunts it with soft hands
shortish on and around off stump, defended after pulling one of his hands off the bat. Lifted a touch more again
that's one of his strong suits, getting up on this toes and thumping the ball on top of its bounce through the covers. Great balance from Faf
walks at him, but Madziva is not quite so obliging. Shortens the length and keeps him to a push through the covers
dropped, is it? It flew quite low to short cover as Amla set up for the on-the-up drive. He's not had his usual timing with the pitch being on the slower side
back of a length and outside off stump, no need to use the bat
short and wide, Amla saw an opportunity but his timing didn't. Beaten on the cut
oh, yes! That's more like it, found the ball in the slot to stroke down the ground. Had so much confidence in himself that he lifted it straight over the bowler's head
oh wristy! Very very wristy as the good length ball is whipped away from off stump to the midwicket boundary. So much for me thinking his timing's off today
shortish and wide enough outside off to make Amla rock back and tap to point
banged in outside off, Amla loads up for the pull and hammers it to deep square leg
looks to crash that through the covers but there isn't as much width as he thought. Settles for chopping it towards mid-off

mid-off dives, he stretches out both hands to his right and takes it! Captain comes to the party and South Africa's openers are back in the hut. It was a fuller ball on off stump, Amla had crunched one of those to the boundary in the last over, but this time he has chipped it to Chigumbura! Bat turned in his hands, it hit quite low, and his usual timing deserts him again
good length ball on off stump, wields a rock-solid forward defensive
that's his first runs in international cricket, has a big smile on his face after he leans into a lovely cover drive. Little too full and a little too wide and taken advantage of serenely
pulls his length back but Rossouw gets back and across and pushes it in front of point
cramps him for room after seeing him quite comfortable through the off side. Turned to square leg
gets back and across to a good length ball on off stump, defended
gets some dip after bowing slower through the air, Faf is lured forward to defend, off the inside edge
nips down the track and having reached the pitch he effortlessly tucks it to long-on. Lovely batting

that's a premeditated lap sweep, which allows the bowler to switch his line towards off stump. Lovely flight again from Nyumbu and he gets a little turn. Struck on the pads, but that would've gone past the off stump
good length ball, turning away from the bat which was camped behind the batsman's shoulder as he leaves
gets back and pushes a shortish ball to long-off
pushed through quicker and flatter, Faf punches to down to long-on
shortish on off stump, Faf presents a straight bat and adds enough power to reach mid-off comfortably
ventures fuller to draw the batsman forward, Faf keeps faith in the drive but his straight bat is too straight
that could have been cracked anywhere, Faf deems it shall go to midwicket and pummels a short and wide ball with a hardly-hit pull.

think that was slower, lobbed up outside off and almost fooled Faf. He was lunging forward, set up for the drive by the time he realised the ball wasn't coming onto him. Tapped it wide of mid-off and takes off
back of a good length on off stump, carefully defended under his eyes
gets forward and pushes a good length ball to mid-off. That's the powerplay done, and Zimbabwe would feel upbeat about their performance so far
gets back, makes some room and cracks a shortish ball through the covers. Sean Williams is at short cover, he dives to his right but only parries it to mid-off
tossed up on and around off stump, Rossouw defends carefully

that's edged, but it flies wide of the first slip! Genuine nick as the bowler tosses it ball up, puts enough revs on it to grip into the deck and fool the batsman. Hard hands from Rossouw doesn't help
out comes the sweep, the go-to shot for most batsmen when the ball is turning. Strongly played to deep square leg
Faf though uses his feet and clips a flighted ball through midwicket. I like his method better
shortish on off stump, keeps Faf to his crease as he pushes to mid-on
good ball that, steered it across the left-hander who is wise to its threat and lets it go
didn't have as much room as he would have liked, but the length was short enough for a pull. Not the full-blooded on, more of a jab through midwicket and that helps him to three runs

leading edge, but he's in such good form that even that has enough bat on it to fly away to the point boundary. Jumps down the track to a fuller ball, it straightens and defeats his flick over midwicket
good length ball on off stump, Faf uses the open face and guides it behind point
good length ball on off stump, shuffles across to push towards mid-on
looks for the yorker, but he has slid it too far down leg. Faf's glance can't connect but it does get his team an extra. And it ended up being only one because of the keeper's good work to his left
stands up tall and punches a shortish ball through to the sweeper
and squares up Faf straight away. This was angled in on middle and veered away off this dry pitch, Faf blocks it by leading with his hands
good length ball at the stumps, Faf blocks it
more turn, but the angle on this was too much. Faf goes back and flicks to deep square leg
stays back, waits for the turn and tucks it through to deep midwicket
a little too much flight there, Faf turns the low full toss through to the left of deep square leg
he's dragged it short, and with no deep midwicket in play, Faf has an easy put away. No I did not mean for that to rhyme. Poor ball, top pull shot, easy boundary
flighted on off stump, driven strongly to long-off
flighted on middle and leg, as he stays around the wicket to the right-hander as well. Tucked away through midwicket
does well, even if he misjudged the length. This was tossed up, but he keeps to his crease, watches it turn and uses soft hands and just about steers it past slip
back of a length, Faf is more confident on his back foot and whips it through square leg
he's slid down leg and Rossouw looks good on the sweep, rolls his wrists on it and keeps the ball along the ground to deep square leg
and Faf's noticed that, leans forward and wanted to lap it fine. Doesn't really connect as well as he wanted. Goes too square
lovely line there, tossed up on middle and off. Faf is brought forward to block
good length ball just outside off, defended off the stumps
goes back and flicks to square leg
tossed up on middle and leg, defended as he keeps his front leg out of the way
doesn't like the fact that he fired this in short, Faf goes back and chops it to long-on
opts for the reverse, set up early enough to give the bowler a warning. Williams pushed it through but the batsman is able to get just about enough bat on it to skittle it fine past the keeper
loads of flight on that, but it ended up being overpitched. Rossouw lashes it through the covers. He looks quite strong with he strokes them like that
good length ball, rips off the deck. Gets some bounce as well as he leaves
optimistic appeal as Rossouw leans forward outside off and blocks. Hit on the pads but the impact was well outside
leans forward and keeps bat and pad close to block a flighted ball outside off
good length ball on off stump, he's shuffling well across to get outside the line and blocks
that's the best of the lot, bowled from around the wicket as he has been doing, it hits middle and rips past the outside edge and into the keeper's gloves
on length on middle and leg, defends it to the leg side
too short this time and Faf rocks back to smash it over midwicket with a pull for a four in the gap. Nearly went all the way for a six
leans forward the defend the length delivery on middle stump
goes back this time to defend it outside off after the turn
full on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on for one
turning in from well outside off, he presses forward to defend it to point and that's drinks
tossed up around off, he goes back to defend it carefully
just short! Faf goes for the paddle sweep for the ball that pitched well outside off and it lobbed up towards leg gully. Waller ran a long way from square leg but it was out of his reach
hits him on the pad on the backfoot well outside off after turning
goes across towards off and defends off the backfoot towards square leg for a quick single
leans forward and pushes it towards cover
paddle sweeps it from outside off to fine leg for one
presses forward and defends the length ball back to the bowler
pushes the length ball from outside off towards cover
comes down a step to push the short of length ball to midwicket
leans forward and pushes this one to cover this time
whips the shorter ball off the back foot just wide of midwicket and says 'wait' thrice
comes down this time and takes it on the pad outside the leg stump and that's a maiden
there's a gap on the off side and Rossouw unleashes a reverse sweep to bisect the gap between point and short third man for a well-timed four
too short this time and Rossouw goes back to cut it off the back foot past cover this time, four again. No sweeper cover
pitches i up now with some turn outside off, Rossouw moves across and his hit on the pad outside off
flighted on middle and leg on good length, leans forward and defends
more flight on middle stump, he moves across a bit again to defend it back
tossed up on off this time, he pressed forward to block it on leg this time
flighted on leg, thick edge goes towards off side after sharp turn
little fuller and it's pushed down to long-off for one
turning on from length and it's outside off, tucked with the turn wide of long-on in the gap for two
bit flatter outside off, leans forward to block it
vicious turn and he's bowled! It was a flighted delivery well outside off, Rossouw saw the width and went for the cut off the back foot but the ball spun very sharply and knocked top of off stump
flighted on middle stump and drifting in, he defends it back to the bowler
bit flat and outside off, pushed back to the bowler
touch wider outside off on length and still flattish, he goes back to block it
bit of flight outside off and it's swept to fine leg for one
comes down the track and drives the full toss to cover
drives the full delivery from outside off straight to cover again
gets it past the fielder now and unleashes a powerful drive! Came down the track and took it on the full to drive it firmly past cover for four
length delivery on leg stump, pushed to short midwicket
on off now on good-length, defends it back to the bowler
drifting in towards middle stump, he blocks it by leaning forward
flight and drift towards his toes, he waits for it and pushes it back again
much shorter on middle stump, he goes back and cuts it down past cover after the turn
what a delivery! Nearly got an edge and the off stump. He pitched it outside leg on length, AB reached out to defend it but the ball whizzed past the outside edge and nearly kissed the off stump
turning it in from well outside of, pushed to cover by Faf
takes a step down to push it down the ground but the bowler pitches it shorter and he's beaten by the turn and bounce to take it on the pad
touch fuller and it's pushed down to long-on just past the bowler
goes on the back foot and whips it to deep midwicket after the turn
shorter and flatter outside off, he gets a thick inside edge on the pad
flighted outside off on length, pushed down with the turn to long-on
sharp turn straightaway! It was well outside off on length and the ball turned in too much to take Faf by surprise
leans forward and blocks it back to the bowler
flight and turn towards the batsman who leans forward to take it on the pad outside off
shorter and wider, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover after it turned in
carefully defends the length ball from off to midwicket
flighted and fuller on off stump, pushed down to long-on for one
from outside off and he goes back and across to whip it on the leg side with the turn
back of length and outside off, pushed down to long-on easily off the back foot
tossed up outside off, AB drives it powerfully to cover
towards the stumps now and full, driven down to long-on for one
goes shorter and outside off, tucked with the turn towards square leg for one
touch fuller outside off, tapped with the turn towards midwicket off the front foot
tossed up well outside off, low full toss is pushed down to long-on
comes down the pitch and blocks the length ball outside off
much shorter outside off and AB goes back this time to punch it powerfully off the back foot to sweeper cover
bit flatter on length just outside off, Faf defends off the back foot
flighted and fuller on off, takes it on the full and defends
goes back expecting a lot of turn as it pitched well outside off, and he defends it outside off as it turned only a bit. Only two from that over
tossed up outside off, tucked to the leg side with the turn for two
flighted on length outside off, he leans forward to defend it back
goes back for the shorter delivery and finds the gap past cover with a cut after it turned, nobody in the deep there
pushed down the ground to long-on for one

dropped, but is he run out? Faf pushed the delivery back to Nyumbu who went to his right to catch it, he could not as he tried with his left hand, but the ball deflected off him and hit the stumps. And guess what, AB's bat is in the air as he tries to get it back in time. He had taken a couple of steps down the pitch and it proved to be too much
slightly full outside off, he pushes it to midwicket with the turn
flight and drift towards off stump, pushed down the ground to long-off to get off the mark
tossed up on length outside off, extra bounce goes towards Faf's waist after an edge
goes on the abck foot and helps the short of length ball with the turn to deep midwicket and that's another fifty from du Plessis
flighted and full on off, driven down to mid-off
short and angled in towards middle stump, tapped off the back foot past midwicket for one
full and drifting in, pushed down to long-off and Chigumbura dives to his left at cover but can't stop it
flighted outside off on length, Duminy drives and is beaten as he goes for a big drive

there's a big gap in the deep on the leg side and Duminy comes down the track to target that by lofting it against the turn. It doesn't go for a four as it was chipped towards the boundary, not tonked powerfully
helps it towards midwicket with the turn for one
takes a step down again and pushes it to midwicket
on length outside off and it's pushed to cover
looks like he was looking to sweep it but it was well outside off and he swished it down to long-off
tossed up on off, defends it back to the bowler
touch shorter outside off and it's helped towards point for one
flight and drift towards middle stump, tucked with the turn past midwicket for one
length delivery with flight outside off, pushed to deep point for one more
takes a step down and defends the length ball back to the bowler
much shorter outside off and it's cut off the back foot to cover point
on length outside off, he goes back to defend it towards point after the turn
flighted a bit more towards off stump, defends by leaning forward now
touch wider outside off and Duminy rocks back to cut it with some timing and power square of the wicket to bisect the gap and collect four
takes a step down and taps the ball towards backward square leg and Faf calls for a quick single
loud cheers from the crowd as the keeper runs and dives towards the short leg area as the ball lobbed off the front pad
pushes it down the ground to long-on to keep strike
not much turn as he goes on the back foot to defend it back
tucks this one off the back foot to deep midwicket for two
comes down a step and defends it on the leg side
short of length and outside off, punched off the back foot and a fumble at cover gives them one
slightly full outside off, driven down to long-off for one
he goes back to defend the back of length ball from outside off and it bounces up towards his shoulders to take him by surprise. Luckily for him the edge didn't carry to point, fell well short
comes down the pitch and defends it to square leg
flighted on middle and leg, pushes it to midwicket off the back foot
fuller on off, tapped towards cover with soft hands with a lean forward for a quick one
sharp turn towards the batsman as he goes on the back foot and punches it down to long off
a bit too short and Duminy knows about the gap on the off side, cuts it from the middle of the bat to punch it past cover as it races to the boundary
flighted outside off, slices a bit late towards point for another quick single as he calls it early
on length outside off, he goes on the back foot to defend it
leans forward this time and defends the ball to cover
much shorter outside off, pushes it to cover
fuller delivery on off stump, pushed towards cover off the front foot
nearly in the block hole on off, digs it out to cover
tossed up on middle, drives it down to long-on for one
tossed up on middle, pushed down the ground with a step to long-on
sharp turn as it goes down leg and beats the batsman and the keeper nearly all the way to the boundary, where a dive saves a run
towards middle stump from length, pushed down to long-on
takes a step down and tucks it to midwicket with the turn
way too short and it's pulled to deep midwicket where a fumble gives them two runs
goes back again and the short ball is swatted to midwicket
pushed through just outside off, Duminy backs away and punches into the covers
shortish again and he cuts through point. There is protection in the deep, but he fumbles it through his legs. Oh dear
wide enough outside off for Duminy to leave alone
this goes on with the arm and Duminy hadn't picked it. Had to hurry into a flick, but there was no bat involved
flighted on middle and leg, turned away in front of square leg
goes back and taps a shortish ball down the ground
this was on a good length but Faf expects it to turn, waits on the back foot and punches through extra cover
tossed up just outside off, Duminy gets in line and blocks off the back foot
pushed through and angled in on middle, Duminy works it and picks it away behind square leg
that's crisply hit through extra cover! Flighted and angled in on leg stump, but Faf backed away and ensure he had enough room to lift it through the infield. Lovely, calculated stroke
that's the quicker one on off stump, keeps Duminy into a forward defensive
jumps down the track and caresses it through extra cover, good job reaching the pitch of that.
lovely, loopy delivery outside off. Duminy waits for it and slices through point
flighted on middle and leg, Faf tickles it around the corner and it's been placed between square and fine leg to pick up a couple. Neat work
did that stay a touch low? Faf crouches down after tapping, a little uppishly, to mid-on. Came off the bottom of the bat and held in the pitch to ruin the punch
shuffles across on off stump and works a good length ball to square leg. Stayed low again
clipped away from outside off to the right of midwicket, that shot's becoming quite productive for Faf
full on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on
skips down the track, but the bowler has adjusted his length. Duminy has soft enough hands and clips it behind square leg. His game against spin has improved considerably
angled in on middle and leg, Faf works it away to square leg
tossed up on middle and leg, Faf gives himself a little room and slices it through point. Ended up reaching for it as he was beaten by flight
slower, but a touch shorter as Duminy rocks back and picks it away behind square leg
nips down the track, but its quicker through the air and hard to get under. Faf settles to tapping it to midwicket
tossed up generously, Duminy reaches as far as he could, takes it on the full and drives to long-off
backs away on leg stump and whips it to short midwicket, the flatter length enabled that stroke, but he can't pick the gap
goes back, stands up tall and punches a shortish ball to cover
that's slower and it seems to get a little more out of the pitch. Stopped on it and makes Duminy's tuck lob up in the air, into no-man's land though at midwicket
flighted, from around the wicket, as he has been bowling into off stump. Duminy gets forward to block and gets an outside edge
eased down the ground as Duminy's front foot stride is long enough to reach the pitch of a flighted ball outside off

a little too much turn to premeditate a reverse sweep. Mild appeal for leg before but the umpire seems to reckon the impact was outside off. Good variation in flight as he pulled the ball back and beat the batsman
instead he puts his faith on his footwork, jumps down the track and drives to long-on
cut away from almost off stump, cracked away to deep point. Manoevring the field quite nicely
flighted and angled in on middle and leg, defended
tossed up on the pads, Faf looks to pierce the gap behind square leg but doesn't execute it properly
dances down to get to the pitch and drives calmly to long-on.
stays still as he meets a good length ball on middle and clips behind square leg
he was loaded up for a cross-bat shot, but the ball has held in the pitch a little more and Duminy adjusted well. Defended with soft hands
goes back and shuffles outside off and flicks behind square leg

oho! That's been thumped. It was short, Faf as he has done so often, made some room for himself but instead of creaming it through a difficult to pierce off side field, he has slapped it straight over the bowler's head
flighted on middle and leg, turns further away
backs away and taps a shortish ball to short cover
flighted on off stump, Faf comes down the pitch and pushes to long-on. End of a pretty good spell from Waller, made the odd ball hold and misbehave.
flighted on off stump, driven to long-on. That full face has been on prominent display today again
shortish and Duminy jumps back and cuts strongly. There is protection in the deep though
pushed through quicker as he sees Faf feigning to use his feet, it's almost a yorker on leg stump but Faf manages to dig it out
shortish and outside off, a little bit of turn and his intention to hit the ball too hard forces the bat face to close and find cover
tossed up and drifting on on middle, Faf blocks down the pitch
switches his stance, but not the grip as he reverse sweeps a full toss through point. Lots of innovation for a couple of runs
tossed up on off stump, Duminy whips it away through midwicket
gets down the track but he can't get under it, drives along the turf to long-off

loads up for a powerful slog sweep, but he chose the wrong ball. Loads of flight and a bit too far outside off. Also holds up, so it's about the worst ball for that shot. Put his head down thinking he had edged to a fielder, but there was no one behind square on the off side
jumps down the track and whips it along the ground through midwicket

hello! That's when innovation works, dancing down the track and lifts this away onto the roof behind long-on! Seems to have taken a bit out of him as he goes to ground, cramping. His footwork has been a treat today, will this discomfort affect him? Gets some fluids into his system, gloves back on. Has popped a pill as well
slog swept, but it came off the inside edge. Slower pitch not enabling those forceful strokes as much as the batsmen would like
pulled his length back as he anticipates Faf advancing, pushes down to long-off softly enough to snare a couple. Lovely running, but that was sluggish fielding more than anything
backs away and chops towards point, shortish and pushed through from Williams
jumps down the track and uses his wrists to flick wide of long-on. Minor misfield, for which Vusi apologises immediately
can't beat short third man as he reverse swats a good length ball from outside off
gets down the track, but he had been making room. Williams had changed his trajectory outside off making the batsmam reach out. Lifted over extra cover, with no real power.

offers up a fuller ball on leg stump, Duminy has swatted it to the square leg boundary. Got forward, slogged around his front leg and made a very solid connection. Looks like he is enjoying pace on the ball
full toss outside off, Duminy slugs it away to the left of long-on. Mistimed it but that is still a well-made fifty

that's the slower ball, and it's fetched a simple wicket. Well done, Madziva. Gets a pat on his head from Faf as he walks off. This was a fullish delivery and Duminy, because of his attacking intent, lunges for it and goes for a swipe. Would have been served better hitting through the line. Ends up a top edge, and the bowler calls for it. Taylor backs off and the catch is taken

full and on the pads, glanced away to the fine leg boundary! Informs the umpire that was bat and then hoists his helmet off. That's a third ton in the series. Not a bad haul from a man who is reasonably new to the No. 3 psotion
that has been hammered over long-off! Pure disdain as he takes a length ball from outside off and clattered it over a backpedalling fielder

through him this time, and its the slower ball that does the trick. Pitched fuller and the offcutter dug into the pitch and turned to sneak through bat and pad as Faf looked to blow it down the ground again

this was flighted on middle and leg, Miller closed the bat face a little too soon. leading edge travels to Nyumbu's left, with him bowling around the wicket, reaches out and gets it with one hand behind the non-striker, but fails to hold on
nudges this flighted ball off his pads to get his first runs
that's in a different arc and its outta the park, Miller would be proud of that. Dropped horribly short and Faf has rocked back and lifted it with every bit of strength he has over deep square leg
this time he uses his feet and looks more graceful lofting a good length ball over midwicket. Magnificent striking

goes for one too many and the top-edge lands into the hands of midwicket. The Zimbabwe fielders run up to shake his hands as Faf walks off the field. This was a touch quicker and not quite as short. Faf was just in that mode and has to perish. Standing ovation from the dressing room
flighted on middle and leg, defended solidly
shortish on leg stump, slower as well. Parnell looks to flick towards midwicket but the ball holds up and doesn't have enough pace for the shot
slower bouncer this time, Parnell swivels on his back foot and pulls down to deep fine leg
clever bowling this, pulls all the pace off the ball and Miller has to adjust his stroke. Thought of booming it down the ground and then checks it for a single to long-off
good length on off stump, Parnell is not so adept at pulling his stroke back. Almost lobbed it back at the bowler, no feet there
jumps down the track to add his own pace to it, but Chatara bangs it into the pitch. Goes for the pull, but it has a little more pace on it to fool his stroke
eased behind point as this was angled across the right-hander
fullish on leg stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
goes for the yorker, but it ends up a low full toss. Just as good as Miller flicks it to deep midwicket
slower ball gone wrong, bounces in front of Taylor to beat him as well. And they've snared three bonus runs, in addition to the extra. Rolled his fingers but had directed it too far down leg
this was in the slot, with enough width to make him free his arms. Miller has shovelled it over the covers. Powerful stroke
that's been dropped short and Miller has pulled it to the left of deep square leg.

cover dives, but he's put it down. Masakadza was the man, who was hunting after that leading edge as Miller flicks. Surprised by the ball flying to him, forces him to fly to his right. He got two hands to it but shelled it as he hit the ground
would have been the last ball, had it not been slid down leg

slower ball, it seems the batsman was waiting for it. Parnell is deep in his crease and hammers it down the ground. Has enough power to clear the fielder and propel the score into seriously competitive territory.

inn2.comm: shapes it away, like he always does, from length outside off, left alone
brings it closer to off on similar length, making Sibanda poke on the back foot and the ball swings away from him
another one swinging away from good-length outside off, he leaves this time
touch fuller outside off on length, Sibanda drives it to mid-off
that's gone high up in the air off the edge, but beats mid-off! He went for the pull, seeing the short ball but a leading edge went very high and luckily for Sibanda fell out of Morkel's reach
short again and Sibanda pulls it straight to midwicket this time
on length on the leg stump, worked off the pads to midwicket for a quick one and he's off the mark straightaway
fuller on leg stump, flicked away past midwicket to long-on for one. Sibanda is putting a lot of power into his shots
slower through the air on middle, he goes back to defend
sharp turn into the batsman from outside off, crams up Sibanda as he looked to make room
hits him outside leg stump after the turn as he went back to play it
leans forward to block this one back to the bowler
short ball goes down the leg side for a wide as Sibanda shouldered arms
width this time outside off and Sibanda crashed it with a powerful cut, but straight to point
back of length on middle and leg, worked off the pads towards short fine leg
what bounce! QDK takes it near his head for this back of length ball outside off as the batsman left it
slightly slower, probably scrambled seam, on length outside off, Raza pushes towards cover
it's too short and he was waiting for that! Pulled away in style from just outside off to the midwicket boundary for four! They are not going to let the loose ones go waste
back of length angled towards leg stump, tucked towards midwicket off the toes
charges down and drives the full toss straight down the ground close to the non-striker for four, beating mid-off for four
on length on middle and leg, worked off the pads towards square leg
angled across this time from outside off, Raza looked to poke and missed
goes shorter and outside off again, punched to point off the back foot
similar length outside off, punched to cover this time
short one on leg and turning down, worked to fine leg for an easy one
bouncer to start the over, he thought of pulling but ducked and swayed out a bit at the end
on length on middle stump, he stays back to defend and a thick outside edge runs down to third man. Oh, there's s fumble from Rossouw and they run another
fuller outside off, driven late a bit wide of third man for one
back of length on the stumps, he defends it back
back of length and angled in, worked off the pads to deep square leg for one
back of length on off stump, he runs it down to third man off the back foot
outside off on a teasing line and length and the ball holds its line, Raza pokes without much footwork and misses
short and wide, he chases and misses and it's called a wide
a bit short again outside off and what a shot from Raza! He went to the back foot and punched it over point with a chip and middled it too, to get four runs
short of length again, pushed off the back foot straight to point
in the air again and it just clears mid-off. It was back of length again and he chipped it off the back foot over the covers this time which was out of mid-off's reach
towards middle and leg from back of length, Raza defends it back
makes room, something he likes doing, and cuts it hard over the covers but there's a fielder in the deep to cut it to two
length delivery angled across, he lets it go
charges down and takes it on the full to punch it down to mid-off for one, didn't quite middle it
on length on off with a bit of angle, pushed towards cover
fuller on the off stump, pushed tentatively to point

direct hit is required and AB gets it! Raza pushed the ball towards cover with soft hands and called for a quick single, Sibanda responded but AB is too quick. He reaches the ball and smashes the stumps at the striker's end to leave Sibanda way out of the crease
back of length just outside off with a bit of outswing and the batsman misses
it's short and pulled for four! He saw the length and pounced on it by staying on the back foot to smash it to the square leg boundary for four
well outside off this time, whacked off the back foot to sweeper cover
on length and outside off, runs it down to third man for one
full this time outside off and Raza drives it firmly past cover for two
back of length and well outside off, he lets it go
fuller outside off and it's driven by leaning forward past cover for two more
short of length towards the pads, worked to midwicket for one
length delivery outside of with outswing, he looked to play it but left it eventually
short ball on leg stump, pulled authoritatively past the umpire for one
edged and four! It was just outside off, Raza flashed and it went past QDK, where there's a slip, and beats third man for four
holes out straight to deep point! Off side is his strong area and he was given room, he chased it and went for a lofted swish to hand it to Miller in the deep
back of length on the leg stump, he hops back to defend and is hit on the pad
seams it in sharply from well outside off, he lets it go
short of length outside off, he cuts it late to third man for one
seams it in a bit again from outside off, left alone again
goes right through him! It was back of length and came in, Taylor looked to defend but the ball bounced and sneaked through the gap past the bat
well outside off again, he lets it go easily
fuller outside off, pushed straight to point off the front foot
length delivery angled away from outside off, pushed to point off the front foot
touch sorter and towards off, he defends it to cover
on middle and off this time, Masakadza defends it on the leg side
too short this time and pulled powerfully to deep midwicket but there's a fielder there
on length outside off and it carries very well to the keeper as Taylor leaves it
back of length on the off stump, he goes back to defend it on off
beats him straightaway! Flighted outside off and beats the outside edge of the defence
leans forward to defend the ball outside off
goes back this time to push the delivery to cover
more flight outside off on length, he drives, and misses again
touch shorter on middle and leg, it's tucked off the back foot to the leg side but no time for a run as AB gets another direct hit
short of length on off and turning away, punched down to long-off for one
short ball on leg and it's pulled away to deep backward square leg for two in the gap
back of length from leg stump, tucked off the hips towards mid-on and they rightly decide against the second
back of length towards the middle stump, inside edge hits Taylor on the right thigh
full this time and Taylor lofts it straight down the ground over the bowler's head and over mid-on for a one-bounce four
short of length this time, he hops back to tuck it on leg side for one
full outside off and it's punched to sweeper cover for one
flight on length outside off, punched off the back foot after the turn to sweeper cover
tossed up on off and middle, he leans forward and blocks
flighted outside off and it's pushed between cover and point for one
touch shorter outside off and it's pushed in the gap between cover and point again
sharp turn this time, pitched around leg and turned a long way for the defence outside off to surprise the batsman
length delivery outside off, pushed off the back foot to cover
on leg and it's reverse swept to short third man
flighted and fuller outside off, this time he gets it past Amla at short third man for two
on the leg stump and it's worked off the pads towards midwicket softly for one
towards off stump and Taylor sweeps it fine on the leg side, there's a big gap there, for two more
on length outside off, he moves across and works it off the pads to square leg
fuller on the off stump and he also sweeps it fine for a single
tossed up on off stump, he leans forward and blocks
flighted just outside off, he waits for it and pushes to cover
that's gone all the way! Phangi went a bit shorter on the leg stump and Masakadza went back to loft it over the midwicket boundary, like a scoop for six
outside off on length, pushed past cover for one
presses forward for the length delivery outside off and blocks
closer to off and a touch shorter, Taylor goes back and defends it
full outside off, it's punched down the ground to mid-off where there's a fumble from du Plessis and once he threw it back to the bowler's end, they took another for the overthrow

another one falls, easy catch for AB at cover! It was slightly full outside off, Masakadza goes for a big drive but doesn't middle it and the ball lobs towards cover where AB has to take a couple of steps towards the 30-yard circle for the catch
back of a length and pushed across the left-hander, not bothered with
on a good length outside off, Williams is stuck in his crease as he blocks with an open face
keeps to his crease again to a good length ball and steers it to deep third man
hit through the covers, though Taylor did push out away from his body. Good enough timing to beat the man in the circle
nicely flighted on middle, from around the wicket, Taylor works it off his toes through square leg
brings him forward on off stump as Williams defends with bat close to pad
gets into a slog over midwicket, but the ball dips on him and goes on with the arm. Counted on a bit of turn and is foiled
pushed through flatter, Williams backs away and swats it to long-off

tossed up on middle, JP flew into a concerted appeal as the batsman shuffled across to turn the ball away. Seemed quite adjacent that, unless he got an inside edge on it. Hit around the knee-roll, the ball did turn enough to threaten the stumps but the umpire doesn't agree
good flight again, pushed through to long-on
another appeal for leg before, but think this hit the inside edge. Big one that thudded onto the thigh pad. Taylor had very little idea the ball had lobbed up and dropped into the off side
back of a length outside off, pushed away through the covers
ill-advised drive on the up from Williams, especially with the pace and bounce of Morkel. Beaten
finds the yorker just outside off, Williams is up for it and the ball bounces over the bails. Morkel is not proving easy here
he is when the length ball is steered that far across the left-hander. Disappointed stare back at the umpire, but that was not a harsh call
back of a length and outside off, Williams is rooted to the crease as he looks to thread it through the covers. Beaten again, and prompts Taylor to walk down and have a chat
tucks him up on middle, Williams manages to work it away behind square leg
gorgeous flight just outside off again, Williams leans in to drive with an open face to point
that was short and wide, but it also kept low. That's what disrupts Williams' attempt to cut it away. Inside edge dribbles by his feet
goes back as this skids on off a good length and hits him on the pads. Would have gone down leg

thuds his bat into the turf as he walks away! Does not enjoy his walk back to the pavilion after the ball takes the inside edge, lobs off the pad and into Amla's hands at first slip. That's another delivery that went straight on, with the batsman playing for turn
flighted on off stump, defended towards point
pushed through on off stump, he jumps back and pats it down the ground to long-on
just short of a good length, Chigumbura gets in line to block
full on off stump, Chigumbura frantically sought to protect his sticks and gets an outside edge that runs away to deep third man
short and a shade outside off, Chigumbura lets it pass harmlessly
good length around the off stump, gets some seam in off the deck to cut the batsman in half. Beaten on the inside edge
back of a length and outside off, the Zimbabwe captain doesn't bother with it
good length with a little tail away, only the keeper needs to worry about it
tossed up on middle and leg, Taylor lunges across on off stump to sweep and gets a feather of a glove onto pad. Could have been a pretty useful shout
yorks himself as he jumps down the track and drills a flighted delivery to mid-off. Went in the air, but it bounces well short. Miller does well to get his body behind it
swept away off the stumps to deep fine leg.
nicely flighted on off stump, tucked away through square leg
pushed back down the ground and there was a cry of "catch" as well, but the ball bounces in front of Duminy, who was diving to his left
picked away off a good length from the stumps, De Villiers patrols the midwicket region and makes them hurry
beaten! Lovely start as he gets a good length ball to straighten off the deck and leave Chigumbura's hanging bat
back of a length and on middle, tucked away through midwicket
back of a good length, Taylor is wary of it being outside off and blocks towards the covers
gets across in line with the stumps and pushes a good length ball to mid-on
that's a pretty shot, standing up on his toes to thump a shortish ball through the covers. Solid thwack off the bat too
shortish and outside off, Chigumbura holds his stance and lets it pass
gets too close to the ball and can't beat mid-off after charging a flighted ball from Duminy on off stump
picked away to the right of midwicket as he closes the bat face on impact with the tossed up delivery
advances and drives down the ground to long-on

takes a couple of steps to his right, flings himself full-length and almost pulls off a blinger. Gets his fingertips to it but then it was punched a little too far away from him. Mis-hit from Taylor as the ball stopped on the pitch
pushed through down the leg side, Chigumbura would be disappointed he didn't pull that away
this time he makes contact with another short ball down the leg side, but can't beat the man at deep fine leg
how did that miss?! Steyn jerks a good length ball sharply in at Chigumbura who was set up for the cut. In the end the ball almost shaved middle and off stump.
sneaks in the awayswinger and Chigumbura was prompted into chasing it. His feet were splayed on leg stump, his hands lead him into the shot. Terrific fast bowling
shortish and outside off, chopped away off the inside half of the bat towards point
goes fuller on middle and leg and gets some movement in as well, Chigumbura plays this a lot later than his previous shots and defends
runs in while hiding the ball and it seems to do his bidding. Veers in off the deck and strikes Chigumbura in his stomach.That would have hurt
he's not too sure whether to move forward or back. Steyn seems to be getting some reverse, this one comes back in to take the inside edge of an uncertain push
loads slower through the air on leg stump, Taylor ticks it toward square leg to bring up the hundred
goes back and clips a good length ball off his pads for a single, and South Africa have assured their place in the final
picked away off his toes to deep midwicket
shortish on off stump, backed away and punches to point
this one was markedly quicker and shorter, Chigumbura gets back and pulls to deep square leg
tossed up nicely on middle and leg, Taylor nudges it towards midwicket and races off to the other end
good length ball in the off stump corridor, Taylor gets back and across and uses soft hands to steer down to third man. Might have been more of an outside edge
shortish and outside off, Chigumbura punches to with an open face to point
gets in line with his stumps to combat Steyn's late movement in off a good length. Enjoys an inside edge that sneaks off towards midwicket
fuller on off stump, Chigumbura inches forward to block that thuds into his front boot
back of a length and outside off, left alone
that's nicely done, got on the back foot to a shortish ball and punches between cover and point.
tossed up outside off stump, he gets down the track and drives to long-on
looped up on middle and leg, Taylor decides to sweep but can't beat short fine leg
gets down the track, but he isn't too keen to attack. Nudged to midwicket
saw him trying to jump down at him and fired in a quicker one on the pads, picked away from the crease to square leg

that's short, it's been pulled... right into the hands of deep midwicket. First ODI wicket for Rossouw and he's chuffed, considering the ball he bowled. Chigumbura though was livid, slammed the bat into the turf
tossed up on leg stump, driven back at the bowler

full and wide of off stump, Taylor launches it over the covers. The bat face turns on impact and he almost slices it. Gets a little too much height than he would have wanted but it allows him to get off strike
that's almost a yorker on off stump, eased out with an open face towards the covers
pulled the pace off a good length ball which nipped back to beat Taylor's flick and hit him on the pads
back of a length and pushed across the right-hander, steered down to third man
that's delightful! An overpitched delivery outside off invites Waller to get forward and stroke through extra cover. Lovely straight face, high elbow and an intention not to hit hard
fullish and wide outside off, he threw his bat at it and retains strike. Not quite so aesthetically pleasing that time but effective enough
shortish and pushed outside off, Waller's cut finds the fielder
goes along with the arm as he flights it outside off. Waller plays for the spin as he looks to drive to mid-off and is beaten
strays down the leg side and he gets down on one-knee to sweep to deep fine leg
tossed up on leg stump, Taylor pulls out the reverse dab and snares a few handy runs to third man
that a touch shorter and quicker on middle and leg, Taylor jumps outside off to half-pull-half-swat towards fine leg
this time Waller rocks back far enough have enough room to clobber the ball to the square leg boundary. Strong pull
full but on the pads, Taylor waits on it and flicks calmly to deep square leg
banged in on middle and off stump, Waller ducks under it
good length ball just outside off, Waller steers it to deep third man

good length ball outside off, Taylor gets forward to block and sets off! The bowler kicked off from his followthrough and flicked the throw at the stumps and it misses by a whisker! Suicidal decision for a single there
shortish and rising towards the batsman's chest, Taylor rises with it and blocks with soft hands
shortish on off stump, tapped to short third man
lovely flight and drift on leg stump, Waller got forward to push and gets a bit of an outside edge towards the off side
a little more turn off a flighted ball angled in on middle, looks for the drive towards the covers and is beaten
tossed up on middle, Taylor got in line to sweep but doesn't get bat on it. Might have been drifting down leg
he's taken his guard on leg stump for this exact shot. He knows the ball is being angled in but that stance has allowed him to free his arms and lift a flighted ball over cover! Top shot
forces the bowler to push it through on middle, Taylor stays back and punches with an open face to point
whipped away from outside off to the right of midiwicket
uses the pace of a short ball angled across him and dabs it to deep third man
keeps the length short and has the batsman hopping, not all that uncomfortably though as Waller tucks it behind square leg. Rossouw keeps it to a single
nips away off the deck, Taylor follows it with his hands and taps them into the ground towards backward point
back of a length and outside off, chopped down to deep third man
shortish and outside off, goes for a cut but doesn't time it. And on that note, we go to drinks

that stays low and beats both batsman and keeper. Taylor stayed put outside leg stump and looked to steer it through the covers but was beaten by the turn. De Kock didn't stay crouched long enough to get that in either
tossed up on the stumps, Tayloe gets forward to drive
tossed up on middle and leg, Taylor goes for a reverse sweep but short third man is in the way
flighted on middle and off stump, he leans forward to drive back down the pitch
stays back and tucks a good length ball with the angle to short fine leg
tossed up on middle to invite the drive, a lovely one answers to long-off where Rossouw misfields to afford an extra run
slants a fuller ball well down the leg side. Look out Steve Harmison
and another one. this time a little tighter than the last time but had still slid down leg
full on off stump, pushed back at the bowler. AB won't let it pass him
good length ball on leg stump, tickled away to square leg
skids on off a good length hand strikes Taylor on the pads. Might have slid down
that's been clobbered! Taylor made a little room for himself and lifts a length ball into the sightscreen
good length ball, with perhaps a little nip in. Taylor was loading up for the thump down the ground and has to adjust
shortish on off stump, tickled away towards long-on but AB races after it himself, in vain because the single was taken nonetheless
flightede on off stump, Taylor nudges it in front of point and scurries across to the other end
stays back, waits for the length ball to turn and taps into the covers
pushed through on leg stump, Waller thinks its a lot shorter than it is and goes for a pull. Inside edges onto the pad. No single off the deflection into the leg side

lots of flitting around the crease and he ends up nicking to the keeper. He made room first, then overcompensated by moving outside off. Phangiso didn't bother about him as he flighted one just outside off stump, the batsman goes for an airy drive and the turn elicits the outside edge. De Kock makes a smart grab and he knows it
good length ball that grips into the pitch and turns past the outside edge
goes for a sweep, but it was a touch wide of off stump and was rather flat too. Mistimes it towards midwicket
back of a length on off stump, Taylor gets in line with it and blocks with the inside edge
back of a good length and it nips in off the deck, Taylor tries to steer it towards third man
goes for the offcutter, but it too seeks timber. Taylor has to get forward and block
another slower ball, this one shorter and shade outside off. Taylor cuts towards point
had enough room to slap a shortish ball to the left of point. The fielder does pull off a diving save but not quite in time to stop Taylor getting to his fifty

that's a terrific catch from the mighty Hash! Diving low to his right at first slip. This was on a good length, hurried Utseya who pokes with his bat first and then the front foot follows. Amla had his eyes on the ball all through and just about managed to hold on
gets down the track and whips a flighted ball over midwicket. Neat work with the wrists
backs away against a shortish ball, quicker and flatter on middle and leg. Taylor manages to cut it away to deep point
flighted on off stump as he goes back to block. Gets it to turn and take the outside edge
bowls a lovely, tempting line outside off. Tossed up outside off and turns away past the driving blade of Madziva
driven down the ground, but he can't find the gap pats mid-on
jumps down the track to defend a good length ball on middle
backs away and swats a short ball over point. Wasn't fussed that the ball was almost head-high, his footwork had put him in a good position to have a go
hits a good length on off stump but Madziva won't make Steyn's job as easy as all that. Defended stoutly
poke and miss from Madziva as he gets this to straighten outside off. He's managed to get this ball to talk on a pretty unhelpful pitch for the quicks
short and wide outside off, Madziva's cut is not quite quick enough
another jaffer! Just a little nip away off the deck and it's enough against a batsman who is nervous. Stays rooted to the crease and hangs his bat out to dry. Lucky not to edge it

bends his back a bit more and gets the ball to lift towards the batsman's chest, Madziva does quite well to absorb the pace and steer it down the third man. Steyn seems quite chirpy against the tailender
gets down the track to drive. But got too close to it and the ball deflects off his toes and makes Madziva rush back into his crease. De Kock almost managed to pull off a stunning run-out

oopsy! He's sought a third run that his partner was absolutely uninterested in. Poor result for him considering he had nailed the sweep to deep square leg. Did everything right - rolled his wrists, kept it along the ground and nearly hit the gap - except look up in time to see Taylor's rather late call of no. Slips and has no chance of returning to safety
shortish and outside off, cut to point

flighted on middle, Chatara pulls out the sweep again and gets an easy single, oh wait there's more on offer. The throw bounces on the square and takes off over the keeper's head. Reared away from him after hitting the square
gets down the track and wears a good length ball on the pads while wanting to block. Would have slid down though
a little turn takes the ball away outside off, Taylor pushes in front of point with an open face
good length ball outside off, launches seeking the adjacent city but misses
full on off stump, Taylor shuffles across to whip it away. Only manages a leading edge to deep point
good length ball just outside off, Chatara isn't too keen to get in line but manages to defend it nonetheless
back of a length and outside off, he almost chased it but pulls his bat back at the last minute. No-ball called for Morkel clipping the stumps with his bowing land
shortish and outside off, a little too far says the umpire as Chatara leaves
back of a length and outside off, defended with an open face
full on off stump, he plonks his bat in line with it and gets a thick outside edge to third man
slugged away to deep fine leg, had to drag it from well outside off which was why he didn't have any timing on it
gets down the track to push a flighted ball through extra cover
this one jags back in off a fuller length, Chatara didn't know it had dribbled away to the off side but Taylor does and pinches a single

gets down the track but only inside edges onto his boot, De Kock races to his right and dives full-length to catch it and asks the question. Think it might have been a bump ball? That's what they are checking and the third umpire rules not out

dropped, made such good ground but perhaps might have been deceived by that. Amla, at point, could have dived, but he did reach as far a she could and then shelled it. Another attempt from Taylor to break free and hit through the off side not quite working out
gets down the track and taps it into the covers
this was a length ball, it sat up and asked Chatara to go for it. So he does and it's been mauled to the long-on boundary. Time for a little tailender fun, it seems
nicely done there, used the pace and bounce of the bowler as he steps away and ramps Morkel wide of the keeper and almost to the third man boundary
chops to deep third man as this is shortish and outside off
back of a length and ducks back in from outside off, Chatara leaves on length and sees the ball sail over off stump
full on middle, defended as solidly as he could
that's a touch too short and he rocks back and hammers a pull through short midwicket. They aren't throwing in the towel yet
gets down the track outside off, the length is not quite full enough to launch. Defended
tossed up on middle and leg, swatted to long-on
tossed up just outside off and gets a little turn, Chatara lets it through the keeper
goes for a slog sweep, but the ball sneaks under his bat and through to the keeper. Tight call for stumping there, but he just about pushed his boot back
ends his spell with a dot ball on middle and off.
back of a length and outside off, steered down to deep third man
switches around the wicket and slides a shortish ball down the leg side. Chatara thought of tickling it down the fine leg but doesn't succeed
short ball outside off, launches into a pull but he's beaten by pace
good length ball on off stump, Chatara defends with soft ahnds and it lobs away to the right of Amla at slip
gets down and slams a shortish ball through extra cover. That was just sheer power from Taylor, ugly swat to great effect
back of a length and outside off, steps away and thumps through to the sweeper
gets back over the wicket to the tailender and bowls a short ball, Chatara sways away and loses balance.
fired through outside off, with a round-arm action. Taylor advances and blocks
beats short fine leg, despite the full-length dive. That was a poor ball from Duminy, allowed Taylor to get under it and lap sweep it to the boundary

goes for the slog again, the equation calls for it. this time though it was an awful hoick at the cost of his balance. Didn't get anywhere close to the ball and off stump is knocked back. Mangongo and the dressing room applauds
flighted on middle and off, he blocks with some authority
pushed through outside off, Nyumbu shuffles across and blocks
good length ball on off stump, Nyumbu tucks it through short leg and gets a single
full and sliding down leg, as he did when he began his first spell
shortish and outside off, chopped away to point
that was the offcutter, gripped in the pitch and almost had the batsman out leg before. Instead its been flicked away towards midwicket
full on leg stump, Chatara tries to whip it away to square leg but misses.
seems to skid off the deck as Chatara blocks a shortish ball on middle
another wide down the pads, found the block hole reasonably well though
that was close! AB knows it as he has hands on his head. Another offcutter pushed fuller and lured Chatara on a slog sweep, misses and it wasn;t too far away from off stump
back of a length and outside off, eased away towards third man
flighted on leg stump, whipped away through midwicket. They see the opportunity for a couple and commit fully to it. Chatara dives headlong to make his ground at the non-strikers' end
flighted on middle, Nyumbu goes for an across-the-line sweep. Hit in front of middle, Umpire Dar reckons it will go on to hit middle and that's all she wrote
